Package lib

Class BinaryHeap<E extends Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
lib.BinaryTree<E>
lib.BinaryHeap<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BinaryHeap<E extends Comparable<E>> extends BinaryTree<E>
The BinaryHeap class is a subclass of the BinaryTree class, and it adds a size field, a parent field, and a depth field to the inherited BinaryTree class
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BinaryHeap

      public BinaryHeap()
      Defaul constructor. Creates an empty heap.

    • BinaryHeap

      public BinaryHeap(BinaryHeap<E> other)
      Parameterized copy constructor. Creates a heap with another heap.
      Parameters:
      other - The heap to be copied.

  • Method Details

    • offer

      public boolean offer(E item)
      The function finds the depth of the node that item will be added, then finds the place of the node that will be added, then adds the node to the heap with protecting heap structure.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be added to the heap.
      Returns:
      The method returns true if the item is added to the heap, otherwise it returns false.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(E item)
      If the item is in the tree, return true. Otherwise, return false.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be searched for
      Returns:
      The node that contains the item.

    • findNode

      protected BinaryHeap<E>.Node<E> findNode(BinaryTree.Node<E> root, E target)
      If the item not in the heap, return null, otherwise return the node.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the tree to search
      item - the item to be found
      Returns:
      The node that contains the item.

    • poll

      public E poll()
      We find the furthest node from the root, then we replace the root with the furthest node, then we fix the heap order.
      Returns:
      The root of the heap.

    • remove

      public E remove()
      If the heap is empty, throw an exception. Otherwise, return the value of the first element in the heap and remove it from the heap.
      Returns:
      The first element in the heap.

    • peek

      public E peek()
      If the heap is empty, return null, otherwise return the root's data.
      Returns:
      The data of the root node.

    • element

      public E element()
      If the heap is empty, throw an exception. Otherwise, return the smallest element in the heap.
      Returns:
      The smallest element in the heap.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this heap.
      Returns:
      The size of the heap.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the heap is empty, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      The size of the heap.

    • merge

      public BinaryHeap<E> merge(BinaryHeap<E> other)
      Merge two binary heaps into a new binary heap.
      Parameters:
      other - The other heap to merge with this one.
      Returns:
      A new BinaryHeap object that contains all the elements of the two BinaryHeap objects that were merged.

    • increaseKey

      public void increaseKey(E current, E newValue)
      If the new value is greater than the current value, then replace the current value with the new value and fix the heap order.
      Parameters:
      current - The current value of the node that you want to change.
      newValue - The new value to be assigned to the node.
